chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

defendant.name: Hamilton, Peter B

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Peter B Hamilton not in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per Attorney Bartelt, defendant did not have a ride. Plea and sentencing date requested. State does not object. Court sets plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant will be waiving preliminary hearing. Court verbally reviews waiver and finds defendant knowingly and freely waives right to preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ian Mickelson appears. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant does qualify for SPD. Attorney Mickelson will not be his attorney. State requests a signature bond. Attorney Mickelson does not object to signature bond. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond. Preliminary hearing set.
